jpg

Class JpgParserAdvanced

  • java.lang.Object
    • common.AbstractImageParser
      • jpg.JpgParserAdvanced

  • public class JpgParserAdvanced
extends AbstractImageParser
    A parser for JPG image files that extracts metadata from the APP segments. This version is updated to handle multi-segment metadata, specifically for ICC and XMP data, in addition to the single-segment EXIF data.

    This parser adheres to the EXIF specification (version 2.32, CIPA DC-008-2019), which mandates that all EXIF metadata must be contained within a single APP1 segment. The parser will search for and process the first APP1 segment it encounters that contains the "Exif" identifier.

    For ICC profiles, the parser now collects and concatenates all APP2 segments that contain the "ICC_PROFILE" identifier, following the concatenation rules defined in the ICC specification. Similarly, for XMP data, it collects and concatenates all APP1 segments with the "http://ns.adobe.com/xap/1.0/" identifier to form a single XMP data block.

    Since:
    25 August 2025
    Version:
    1.5
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs

    • Method Detail

      • reconstructXmpSegments

        private java.util.Optional<byte[]> reconstructXmpSegments(java.util.List<byte[]> segments)
        Reconstructs a complete XMP metadata block by concatenating multiple raw XMP segments.

        The Extensible Metadata Platform (XMP) specification allows XMP data to be stored across multiple APP1 segments within a JPEG file. This method reassembles these fragments into a single, cohesive byte array for parsing.

        Parameters:
        segments - the list of byte arrays, each representing a raw APP1 segment containing XMP data.
        Returns:
        an Optional containing the concatenated byte array, or returns Optional.empty() if no segments are available

      • reconstructIccProfile

        private java.util.Optional<byte[]> reconstructIccProfile(java.util.List<byte[]> segments)
        Reconstructs a complete ICC metadata block by concatenating multiple ICC profile segments. Segments are ordered by their sequence number as specified in the header.
        Parameters:
        segments - the list of raw ICC segments
        Returns:
        an Optional containing the concatenated byte array, or empty if valid segments are unavailable

      • fetchNextSegment

        private java.util.Optional<JpgSegmentConstants> fetchNextSegment(ImageFileInputStream stream)
                                                          throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the next JPEG segment marker from the specified input stream.
        Parameters:
        stream - the input stream of the JPEG file, positioned at the current read location
        Returns:
        an Optional<JpgSegmentConstants> representing the marker and its flag, or Optional.empty() if end-of-file is reached
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading from the stream

      • readMetadataSegments

        private JpgParserAdvanced.JpgSegmentData readMetadataSegments(ImageFileInputStream stream)
                                                       throws java.io.IOException
        Reads all supported metadata segments (EXIF, ICC, XMP) from the JPEG file.
        Parameters:
        stream - the input JPEG stream
        Returns:
        a JpgParserAdvanced.JpgSegmentData record containing the byte arrays for any found segments
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs
